spoken-english-week7_key2:
Hello!! 
This is your Class 7 for Spoken English course module.
spoken-english-week7_key4:
Pair and Share: 
Topic: My Friend
Who is one of your friends?
What does he/she look like?
How and when did you meet?
What do you do together with your friend?
spoken-english-week7_key6: Volunteers may explain to students that pronouns are substitutes for nouns.Let's concentrate today on Personal Pronouns. Personal pronouns are used as an object or a subject. Below is a list of pronouns that will be used in the game and examples to help the student understand how to use it.
spoken-english-week7_key12: *I* wanted an apple.Mom, can you please give *me* an apple
spoken-english-week7_key15: If you have any questions, you canask either Divya or me
spoken-english-week7_key18: He played with his toys in the playground
spoken-english-week7_key21: She bent down to tie her shoe lace
spoken-english-week7_key24: It is my favorite book.Divya wants to borrow it
spoken-english-week7_key27: We were delighted when the teacher called and told us that tomorrow is a Holiday
spoken-english-week7_key30: Both of them were surprised to see their dad at home when they returned
spoken-english-week7_key31: Choose the nouns and replace with the right Pronoun
spoken-english-week7_key32:
Anna, Divya and David went to the market. ( They went to the
market)
spoken-english-week7_key33:
Anand said Anand would clean Anand ’s room. ( Anand said he
would clean his room)
spoken-english-week7_key34: Pranav and I ate the ice cream.( He and I ate the ice cream)
spoken-english-week7_key35:
You and Hari are invited to the game.( You and him are invited
to the game)
spoken-english-week7_key36: **Select the right pronoun from I , me, we , us**
spoken-english-week7_key37: John uis several inches taller than _____ (me)
spoken-english-week7_key38: _____ cannot go to the park today.(I/We)
spoken-english-week7_key40: Jack has a better pen than_____ (me)
spoken-english-week7_key41: David and John can’t sing as well as _____ (us).
spoken-english-week7_key43:
**Flexible** (adjective)
Meaning: (1) capable of bending easily without breaking
spoken-english-week7_key44: Usage: Giraffes have very flexible necks.
spoken-english-week7_key45: (2- When referring to a person) ready and able to change so as to adapt to different circumstances.
spoken-english-week7_key46: Usage: (of a person) Tara’s schedule was flexible
spoken-english-week7_key49: Who is one of your friends?
spoken-english-week7_key51: How and when did you meet?
spoken-english-week7_key52: What do you do together with your friend?
spoken-english-week7_key53: ### Level 2: Why is a friend important in life?
spoken-english-week7_key55:
Pronouns are substitutes for nouns . Let's concentrate today on Personal and Reflexive Pronouns.
Personal pronouns are used as an object or a subject. Below is a list of pronouns that will be used in the game and examples to help the student understand how to use it.
spoken-english-week7_key61: *I* wanted an apple.Mom, can you please give *me* an apple
spoken-english-week7_key64: If you have any questions, you can ask either Divya or me
spoken-english-week7_key67: He played with his toys in the playground
spoken-english-week7_key70: She bent down to tie her shoe lace
spoken-english-week7_key73: It is my favorite book.Divya wants to borrow it
spoken-english-week7_key76: We were delighted when the teacher called and told us that tomorrow is a Holiday
spoken-english-week7_key79: Both of them were surprised to see their dad at home when they returned
spoken-english-week7_key80: Reflexive pronouns are used to specify that the subject is doing something by or to itself. Instead of acting upon another object, the subject is acting upon itself, either literally or figuratively.
spoken-english-week7_key82: I taught myself to play the guitar.
spoken-english-week7_key83: You know yourself better than anyone else.
spoken-english-week7_key84: We have been preparing ourselves for the monsoon.
spoken-english-week7_key110: Correct the `errors` in the following sentences.
spoken-english-week7_key111: Most of we boys attend the meetings.(us)
spoken-english-week7_key112: I and Jane were nominated for office.( We)
spoken-english-week7_key113: The team members they are quite thrilled about their success.
spoken-english-week7_key114: Them are my kind of people. ( they)
spoken-english-week7_key115: The dog is always scratching it .(itself)
spoken-english-week7_key116: Mark and Mike,please read quietly to you. (yourselves)
spoken-english-week7_key117: Our neighbors were nice enough to deliver the papers for we. (us)
spoken-english-week7_key118:
Us girls are planning to defeat the boys in our school
sports this year.(We)
spoken-english-week7_key119: The kitten it wouldn’t harm anyone.
spoken-english-week7_key121: Them are the shoes to buy if you are looking for comfor`tab`le shoes.(These)
spoken-english-week7_key122: I see me in the mirror. (myself)
spoken-english-week7_key124:
Anxious (adjective)
Meaning: (1) experiencing worry, or nervousness, typically about an
imminent event or something with an uncertain outcome
Usage: She was anxious about her exam results
(2) wanting something very much, typically with a feeling of unease.
Usage: He anxiously waited for India to win the cricket match
